course_title: Environmental Health Seminar: Methods for Environm.Mixtures
class_notes: Topic: Methods for Environmental Mixtures.  This course provides an overview of selected environmental mixture methods and data analysis techniques commonly used in public health research. The course also focuses on developing an understanding of when to use a specific method, the pros and cons of different approaches, and hands-on applications of environmental mixture methods in R. PREREQUISITES: BIOS 500 and EPI 530; BIOS 501 or BIOS 591P are recommended; comfortable using R and/or are concurrently taking BIOS 544 or EH 590R: R-based Quantitative Data Analysis for Environmental Health Research or instructor permission.
course_description: Various topics by GDEH faculty. Check OPUS/Atlas for current topics and descriptions.
schedule_location: T 3pm-4:50pm in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. R345
sections: Class Nbr: 1859, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 3-4:50p, Instructor: Eick/Taibl, Status: Open
